comment_data.body:
I think the issue might be here: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/a03e00a3539ea995c69196aeb35d84912ead8c3f/src/nvim/edit.c#L4277

`get_sts_value() == 0` should be `get_sts_value() <= 0`

**edit:** that did not fix it.

I wonder if the problem is more general. Even if I have `softtabstop` set at 0, I am seeing problems with clipped characters after formatting with `gopls`. (However, the problem doesn't seem to be `gopls` since on other editors, things are fine.)

Here's a minimal example: https://gist.github.com/telemachus/4d19dfb2cb32633342adeb4e5e61bb7e

I was just about to post an issue separately, but I saw yours when searching for similar problems. Do you think these are related?

@telemachus I think your issue is caused by `vim.lsp.buf.code_action` being async. Doing the `vim.buf.lsp.format({ async = false})` first should fix the clipping issue. But you'll notice the `source.organizeImports` changes won't be persisted to the file. See https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/24168

@icholy Thanks for tracking that down for me and explaining. I'm pretty sure that you're right because it explains why this method *does work*:

```lua
local goimports = function(wait_ms)
    wait_ms = wait_ms or 1000
    local params = lsp.util.make_range_params()
    params.context = { only = { 'source.organizeImports' } }
    local result =
        lsp.buf_request_sync(0, 'textDocument/codeAction', params, wait_ms)
    for _, res in pairs(result or {}) do
        for _, r in pairs(res.result or {}) do
            if r.edit then
                lsp.util.apply_workspace_edit(r.edit, 'UTF-8')
            else
                lsp.buf.execute_command(r.command)
            end
        end
    end
end

autocmd('BufWritePre', {
    pattern = '*.go',
    callback = function()
        goimports()
        lsp.buf.format({ async = false })
    end,
    group = telemachus_augroup,
})
```

When the `tabstop` and `shiftwidth` are not equal the tabs are inserted as individual spaces here:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/a03e00a3539ea995c69196aeb35d84912ead8c3f/src/nvim/edit.c#L4307-L4320

Then it goes back and rewrites those to tabs if there are enough spaces.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/a03e00a3539ea995c69196aeb35d84912ead8c3f/src/nvim/edit.c#L4322

Those initial space inserts call `buf_updates_send_changes`, but the second pass which converts to tabs doesn't call `buf_updates_send_changes`.

title: LSP: incremental sync breaks when softtabstop < 0
